snippet: A little clapboard house in Brooklyn got an offer after two weeks on the market, despite its being across the street from a huge, new arena.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column focuses on 474 Dean Street, small clapboard house sitting only a few dozen yards from Barclays Center in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn; notes that house, in an area where only 12 houses sold in 2012, received an offer two weeks after being listed for $1.495 million.
lead_paragraph: A little clapboard house in Brooklyn got an offer after two weeks on the market, despite its being across the street from a huge, new arena.

headline.seo: In Barclays Center’s Shadow, a House Is Snapped Up
headline.main: A House in the Barclays Center’s Shadow Doesn’t Linger on the Market
headline.print_headline: A House in the Barclays Center’s Shadow Doesn’t Linger on the Market
